© 2021 AerCap |Confidential property of the company, not for disclosure or use without permissionAs part of AerCap’s commitment 
t
o responsible and sustainable 
business practices, we have partnered with First Climate to partially offset our carbon footprint arising from our global office operations and employee business travel in 2019
This initiative benefits a project in Ningxia, China, where solar power is used as an alternative source of energy to generate clean energy
The renewable energy project is certified under the Gold Standard an independent certification standard, designed to ensure that carbon credits are not only real and verifiable but that they make measurable contributions to sustainable development
While focusing on 
reducing greenhouse gas emissions, the project also generates multiple co-benefits. These 
are supportive of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals
The project activity 
i
ncreases the regional 
energy supply, with clean and affordable options. This promotes local development and enhances social well -
beingThis project generates employment opportunities for professional, skilled and unskilled personnel during the construction, operation and maintenance of the solar plant
It creates business opportunities for local stakeholders such as vendors, contractors and suppliers, further supporting the local economyThe project displaces energy from fossil fuels and thus improves local air and water quality by reducing other pollutants such as sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, soot and particles associated with the burning of fossil fuels
